meanings.definition: A single thickness of a material covering a surface or forming an overlying part.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a delicious layer of frosting on top.
meanings.sent2: She added another layer of paint to the canvas to make it more vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to nap on the warm layer of laundry fresh from the dryer.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a layer of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The snow-covered landscape sparkled under a thick layer of ice.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that lays something.
meanings.sent1: The hen was a diligent layer, producing fresh eggs every morning.
meanings.sent2: The worker bee is a key layer in the process of building a hive.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel became a mischievous layer of acorns in the garden.
meanings.sent4: She was a layer of foundation for the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: The artist was a skilled layer of colors on the canvas.

meanings.definition: A stratum of rock or soil.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists discovered a layer of ancient artifacts buried deep underground.
meanings.sent2: Each layer of sediment tells a story about the Earth's history.
meanings.sent3: The garden was a layer of tranquility amidst the bustling city.
meanings.sent4: Time is a layer that slowly shapes the landscape around us.
meanings.sent5: The mountain revealed a layer of different colored rocks as it eroded over time.
